moves.1. e4:
Hello everyone, and today I will annotate a game I finished recently. 


White starts with e4
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6:
the petrov's defence. Most opponents played Nxe5, and after d6, they could play 4.Nf3 or 4.Nxf7!?
After 4.Nf3 Nxe4, the most common move is Nc3. The move I hated to see was the very dull 5.d4.
moves.3. Nc3: Petrov 3 knights. 3...Bb4 is supposed to be really OK for black. I choose the 4 knights game.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Bc4: A perfectly reasonable move, but I don't like it because black can play 4...Nxe4 with equality.
moves.4... Nxe4 5. Nxe4: the intermezzo Bxf7ch?! is inferior because I get a strong center, and my king can artificially castle.
moves.6. Bxd5: the best continuation is Bd3, keeping the 2 bishops.
moves.8. h3: another move in the DB was 8.Bh6, but this lacks a direct threat, and after something simple, like long castling, the bishop will have to go again.
moves.8... Bh5 9. Qe2: I really don't like this move. Black can get instant edge with Nd4
moves.9... Nd4: now white's position is totally inferior no matter what he plays.
moves.10... Qa5+: according to my instant analysis, white's best try will give him a much inferior endgame.
moves.11. Qd2: a mistake. Loss of material is inevitable.
moves.11... Bb4 12. Nc3: now I pick up a piece easily. Hopefully you can spot in a few seconds at most.
moves.12... Bxf3: the bishop is immune, and white is still in great difficulty.
moves.13. O-O: Now I see a simple way to win.
moves.15. bxc3: it doesn't matter anymore, white's position is completely destroyed.
moves.15... Bxc3 16. Qe3 Bxa1 17. Qxf3: The smoke has all cleared, and I am up a rook and a pawn.
moves.19. Bc1: horrid, but it really doesn't matter.
moves.20. Qg4+ Rd7: I plan to double rooks, win more material, trade, and win.h
moves.21. f4 Rhd8: now the king goes to b1, and my pieces are all better, I am also a rook up.
moves.22. Rd1 Qxa2 23. Bd2: I'll give the rest without comments..
